message_1: Using the block cipher AES-256, if the plaintext block is 128 bits long and the key is 256 bits long, what will be the size of the resulting ciphertext block?
message_2: In AES-256, the size of the resulting ciphertext block will be the same as the size of the plaintext block, which is 128 bits. The block cipher AES operates on fixed-size blocks and produces output blocks of the same size, regardless of the key length.
